decks.notes: The main concept of this Legacy deck is to aggressively play powerful threats like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze. The deck aims to control the board and tempo of the game through discard spells and counterspells, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures. Additionally, the deck uses cards like Reanimate and Snuff Out for additional utility and removal. The mana base is optimized for consistency, with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure smooth gameplay.

The main concept of this Aggro Canadian Threshold deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent through aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets, while disrupting their game plan with efficient counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Wasteland and Stifle, while also generating card advantage and gaining incremental value with Planeswalker Wrenn and Six. Overall, the deck is focused on tempo, applying pressure, and disrupting the opponent's strategy to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy threats such as Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Gurmag Angler while disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Daze. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Wrenn and Six and Oko, Thief of Crowns to generate value and control the board. In addition, the deck features a strong mana denial strategy with cards like Wasteland and utilizes a high amount of counter magic to protect its threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary resources to generate a high storm count and create a lethal Tendrils of Agony finish. By utilizing efficient mana-generating spells such as Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond, as well as card draw and selection with Brainstorm, Preordain, and Ponder, the deck aims to set up a successful combo turn that can win the game in one explosive sequence. Thoughtseize, Duress, and Infernal Tutor provide disruption and consistency in finding key combo pieces, showcasing the deck's reliance on precise timing and sequencing to achieve victory.

This deck focuses on using the Bomberman combo with Auriok Salvagers and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate infinite mana. The combo is supported by Karn, the Great Creator to find pieces and Mystic Forge to cast spells from the top of the library. Monastery Mentor and Walking Ballista provide additional win conditions. Chalice of the Void and Engineered Explosives help control the opponent's board. The deck aims to assemble the combo quickly while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like City of Traitors and Cavern of Souls.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board by utilizing powerful cards like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic to put pressure on the opponent while also having access to a variety of versatile spells such as Force of Will and Brainstorm to disrupt their strategy. The inclusion of cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides additional options for dealing with threats or generating card advantage. Additionally, the deck has mana ramp in the form of Gilded Goose and Knight of the Reliquary to help stay ahead and stabilize the game.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through spells like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond, allowing the player to cast multiple spells in a single turn and build up storm count. This deck utilizes cards like Infernal Tutor and Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent after generating a high storm count. The inclusion of disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize helps to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to combo off and win the game quickly through a high storm count.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent as quickly as possible by deploying efficient threats such as Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Gurmag Angler, while disrupting their game plan with countermagic like Daze, Force of Will, and Force of Negation. The deck also includes versatile removal like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is optimized for consistency with fetch lands and dual lands, while also including Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck revolves around assembling the Dark Depths combo, using cards like Vampire Hexmage and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It includes cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Elvish Reclaimer to tutor for the key pieces quickly. Thoughtseize, Duress, and Inquisition of Kozilek help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Brainstorm and Mox Diamond provide card advantage and mana acceleration. The deck also includes utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland to deal with opposing threats, making it a powerful and efficient combo deck in the Legacy format.

The primary strategy of this deck is to aggressively control the board by efficiently dealing with threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan. It aims to achieve this by utilizing a combination of powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets, along with disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle. The deck also has access to versatile planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Wrenn and Six to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. This allows the deck to apply pressure while maintaining control over the game and ultimately outpace the opponent.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays and tempo control, utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, backed up by powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will. The goal is to apply pressure early on using creatures and disruption spells to control the game and prevent the opponent from stabilizing. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Wrenn and Six to generate incremental advantage. Additionally, mana denial with cards like Wasteland helps to keep the opponent off balance and disrupt their game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of fast mana (Lion's Eye Diamond, Lotus Petal, Dark Ritual), card selection (Ponder, Preordain, Brainstorm), disruption (Duress, Thoughtseize), and tutors (Infernal Tutor, Dark Petition) to quickly assemble the pieces needed to generate a large storm count and win the game with Tendrils of Agony. The deck also includes the graveyard recursion of Past in Flames to provide additional resources and the ability to cast spells from the graveyard. Additionally, Veil of Summer provides protection from disruption spells, allowing the combo to go off more easily.

The deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly and efficiently bring out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ashen Rider onto the battlefield. It utilizes cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead to cheat these creatures into play early in the game, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Unmask. The deck aims to create explosive plays and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to establish their own game plan, ultimately leading to a quick victory.

The main goal of this combo-storm deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana through rituals and mana acceleration, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with discard spells. The deck aims to draw into its key pieces such as Dark Petition and Infernal Tutor to search for Tendrils of Agony or Empty the Warrens to finish off the opponent with a high storm count. The deck also utilizes cantrips like Ponder and Preordain to dig for its combo pieces and maximize its consistency in going off.

This deck focuses on generating a high amount of mana quickly through rituals and fast mana sources like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal. The goal is to cast a flurry of cheap cantrips like Ponder and Preordain to find the necessary combo pieces like Dark Ritual and Infernal Tutor to then cast Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam for a game-ending storm count. Thoughtseize and Duress disrupt the opponent's game plan while Dark Petition and Past in Flames provide additional utility and recursion. The deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn.
